00002 # Author:   Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)

00004 # Brief:    Contains namespace which handles displaying file version differences

00006 namespace eval diff {
00007 
00008   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00009 
00010   array set data {}
00011   
00012   # Check to see if the ttk::spinbox command exists
00013   if {[catch { ttk::spinbox .__tmp }]} {
00014     set data(sb)      "spinbox"
00015     set data(sb_opts) "-relief flat -buttondownrelief flat -buttonuprelief flat"
00016   } else {
00017     set data(sb)      "ttk::spinbox"
00018     set data(sb_opts) ""
00019     destroy .__tmp
00020   }

00022   proc create_diff_bar {txt win} {
00023 
00024     variable data
00025 
00026     set data($txt,win) $win
00027 
00028     ttk::frame      $win
00029     ttk::label      $win.l1   -text "Version System: "
00030     ttk::menubutton $win.cvs  -menu $win.cvsMenu -direction above
00031     ttk::button     $win.show -text "Update" -command "[ns diff]::show $txt"
00032 
00033     # Create the version frame
00034     ttk::frame $win.vf
00035     ttk::label $win.vf.l1 -text "    Start: "
00036     $data(sb)  $win.vf.v1 {*}$data(sb_opts) -textvariable [ns diff]::data($txt,v1) -state readonly -command "[ns diff]::handle_v1 $txt"
00037     ttk::label $win.vf.l2 -text "    End: "
00038     $data(sb)  $win.vf.v2 {*}$data(sb_opts) -textvariable [ns diff]::data($txt,v2) -state readonly -command "[ns diff]::handle_v2 $txt"
00039 
00040     grid rowconfigure    $win.vf 0 -weight 1
00041     grid columnconfigure $win.vf 2 -weight 1
00042     grid $win.vf.l1 -row 0 -column 0 -sticky ew -padx 2
00043     grid $win.vf.v1 -row 0 -column 1 -sticky ew -padx 2
00044     grid $win.vf.l2 -row 0 -column 2 -sticky ew -padx 2
00045     grid $win.vf.v2 -row 0 -column 3 -sticky ew -padx 2
00046 
00047     # Create the file frame
00048     ttk::frame             $win.ff
00049     wmarkentry::wmarkentry $win.ff.e -watermark "Enter starting file"
00050 
00051     grid rowconfigure    $win.ff 0 -weight 1
00052     grid columnconfigure $win.ff 0 -weight 1
00053     grid $win.ff.e -row 0 -column 0 -sticky ew -padx 2
00054     
00055     # Create the command frame
00056     ttk::frame $win.cf
00057     wmarkentry::wmarkentry $win.cf.e -watermark "Enter difference command"
00058 
00059     grid rowconfigure    $win.cf 0 -weight 1
00060     grid columnconfigure $win.cf 0 -weight 1
00061     grid $win.cf.e -row 0 -column 0 -sticky ew -padx 2
00062     
00063     grid rowconfigure    $win 0 -weight 1
00064     grid columnconfigure $win 3 -weight 1
00065     grid $win
00066     grid $win.l1   -row 0 -column 0 -sticky ew -padx 2 -pady 2
00067     grid $win.cvs  -row 0 -column 1 -sticky ew -padx 2 -pady 2
00068     grid $win.vf   -row 0 -column 2 -sticky ew         -pady 2
00069     grid $win.ff   -row 0 -column 3 -sticky ew         -pady 2
00070     grid $win.cf   -row 0 -column 4 -sticky ew         -pady 2
00071     grid $win.show -row 0 -column 5 -sticky ew -padx 2 -pady 2
00072 
00073     # Hide the version frame, file frame and update button until they are valid
00074     grid remove $win.vf
00075     grid remove $win.ff
00076     grid remove $win.cf
00077     grid remove $win.show
00078 
00079     # When text widget is destroyed delete our data
00080     bind $win <Destroy> "diff::destroy $txt"
00081 
00082     # Create the CVS menu
00083     menu $win.cvsMenu -tearoff 0
00084 
00085     # Populate the CVS menu
00086     set first 1
00087     foreach type [list cvs file command] {
00088       if {!$first} {
00089         $win.cvsMenu add separator
00090       }
00091       foreach name [get_cvs_names $type] {
00092         $win.cvsMenu add radiobutton -label $name -variable [ns diff]::data($txt,cvs) -value $name -command "[ns diff]::update_diff_frame $txt"
00093       }
00094       set first 0
00095     }
00096 
00097   }

00099   ######################################################################
00100   # Deletes all data associated with the given text widget.
00101   proc destroy {txt} {
00102 
00103     variable data
00104 
00105     array unset data $txt,*
00106 
00107   }

00109   ######################################################################
00110   # Performs the difference command and displays it in the text widget.
00111   proc show {txt} {
00112 
00113     variable data
00114     
00115     # Get the current working directory
00116     set cwd [pwd]
00117 
00118     # Get the current filename
00119     set fname [[ns gui]::current_filename]
00120     
00121     # Set the current working directory to the directory of the file
00122     cd [file dirname $fname]
00123     
00124     # Set fname to the tail of fname
00125     set fname [file tail $fname]
00126 
00127     # If the CVS has not been set, attempt to figure it out
00128     if {![info exists data($txt,cvs)] || ($data($txt,cvs) eq "")} {
00129       set_default_cvs $txt
00130     }
00131     
00132     # Get the CVS namespace name
00133     set cvs_ns [string tolower $data($txt,cvs)]
00134     
00135     # If the V2 file changed, replace the current file with the new content
00136     if {[info exists data($txt,last_v2)] && ($data($txt,v2) ne $data($txt,last_v2))} {
00137       
00138       set v2_fname $fname
00139     
00140       # If the currently selected version is not current, get the file command
00141       if {$data($txt,v2) ne "Current"} {
00142         set v2_fname [${cvs_ns}::get_file_cmd $data($txt,v2) $fname]
00143       }
00144 
00145       # Execute the file open and update the text widget
00146       if {![catch { open $v2_fname r } rc]} {
00147         $txt configure -state normal
00148         $txt delete 1.0 end
00149         $txt insert end [read $rc]
00150         $txt configure -state disabled
00151       }
00152       
00153       # Save the last V2
00154       set data($txt,last_v2) $data($txt,v2)
00155       
00156     }
00157 
00158     # Displays the difference data
00159     switch [${cvs_ns}::type] {
00160       cvs     { ${cvs_ns}::show_diff $txt $data($txt,v1) $data($txt,v2) $fname }
00161       file    { ${cvs_ns}::show_diff $txt [$data($txt,win).ff.e get] $fname }
00162       command { ${cvs_ns}::show_diff $txt [$data($txt,win).cf.e get] }
00163     }
00164 
00165     # Hide the update button if we are in cvs mode
00166     if {$cvs_ns eq "cvs"} {
00167       grid remove $data($txt,win).show
00168     }
00169     
00170     # Reset the current working directory
00171     cd $cwd
00172 
00173   }

00179   ######################################################################
00180   # Gets a sorted list of all available CVS names.
00181   proc get_cvs_names {type} {
00182 
00183     set names [list]
00184 
00185     foreach name [namespace children] {
00186       if {([${name}::type] eq $type) && ([${name}::name] ne "CVS")} {
00187         lappend names [${name}::name]
00188       }
00189     }
00190 
00191     return [lsort $names]
00192 
00193   }

00195   ######################################################################
00196   # Attempts to determine the default CVS that is used to manage the
00197   # current file and updates the UI elements to match.
00198   proc set_default_cvs {txt} {
00199 
00200     variable data
00201     
00202     # Get the current filename
00203     set fname [file tail [[ns gui]::current_filename]]
00204 
00205     set data($txt,cvs) "diff"
00206 
00207     # Check each of the CVS
00208     foreach cvs [get_cvs_names cvs] {
00209       if {[[string tolower $cvs]::handles $fname]} {
00210         set data($txt,cvs) $cvs
00211         break
00212       }
00213     }
00214     
00215     # Update the UI to match the selected CVS
00216     update_diff_frame $txt
00217 
00218   }
00219 
00220   ######################################################################
00221   # Called whenever the CVS value is changed.
00222   proc update_diff_frame {txt} {
00223 
00224     variable data
00225 
00226     set win $data($txt,win)
00227 
00228     switch [[string tolower $data($txt,cvs)]::type] {
00229       
00230       cvs {
00231         
00232         # Remove the file and command frames from view
00233         grid remove $win.ff
00234         grid remove $win.cf
00235 
00236         # Get all of the versions available for the file
00237         get_versions $txt
00238 
00239         if {[llength $data($txt,versions)] > 1} {
00240 
00241           # Show the version frame and update button
00242           grid $win.vf
00243           grid $win.show
00244 
00245           # Configure the spinboxes buttons
00246           $win.vf.v1 configure -values [lreverse [lrange $data($txt,versions) 1 end]]
00247           $win.vf.v2 configure -values [lindex $data($txt,versions) 0]
00248 
00249         } else {
00250 
00251           grid remove $win.vf
00252           grid remove $win.show
00253 
00254         } 
00255         
00256       }
00257       
00258       file {
00259         
00260         # Remove the version and command frames
00261         grid columnconfigure $win 4 -weight 0
00262         grid remove $win.vf
00263         grid remove $win.cf
00264 
00265         # Display the file frame and update button
00266         grid columnconfigure $win 3 -weight 1
00267         grid $win.ff
00268         grid $win.show
00269 
00270         # Set keyboard focus to the entry widget
00271         focus $win.ff.e.e
00272 
00273       }
00274       
00275       command {
00276         
00277         # Remove the version and file frames
00278         grid columnconfigure $win 3 -weight 0
00279         grid remove $win.vf
00280         grid remove $win.ff
00281 
00282         # Display the command frame and update button
00283         grid columnconfigure $win 4 -weight 1
00284         grid $win.cf
00285         grid $win.show
00286 
00287         # Set keyboard focus to the entry widget
00288         focus $win.cf.e.e
00289 
00290       }
00291 
00292     }
00293 
00294     # Set the menubutton name
00295     $win.cvs configure -text $data($txt,cvs)
00296 
00297   }

00299   ######################################################################
00300   # Get the available versions based on the currently selected CVS.
00301   proc get_versions {txt} {
00302 
00303     variable data
00304 
00305     # Get the versions
00306     set data($txt,versions) [list "Current" {*}[[string tolower $data($txt,cvs)]::versions [[ns gui]::current_filename]]]
00307 
00308     # Set the version 2 value to the current value
00309     set data($txt,v2) "Current"
00310 
00311     # Set the version 1 value to the second value
00312     set data($txt,v1) [lindex $data($txt,versions) 1]
00313 
00314   }
00315 
00316   ######################################################################
00317   # If the version of the ending version is less than or equal to the new
00318   # starting version, adjust the ending version to be one version newer
00319   # than the starting version.
00320   proc handle_v1 {txt} {
00321 
00322     variable data
00323 
00324     # Find the current V1 version in the versions list
00325     set index [lsearch $data($txt,versions) $data($txt,v1)]
00326     
00327     # Adjust version 2, if necessary
00328     if {$data($txt,v1) >= $data($txt,v2)} {
00329       set data($txt,v2) [lindex $data($txt,versions) [expr $index - 1]]
00330     }
00331 
00332     # Update V2 available versions
00333     $data($txt,win).vf.v2 configure -values [lreverse [lrange $data($txt,versions) 0 [expr $index - 1]]]
00334     
00335     # Make sure the update button is visible
00336     grid $data($txt,win).show
00337 
00338   }
00339 
00340   ######################################################################
00341   # Handles a change to the V2 widget.
00342   proc handle_v2 {txt} {
00343 
00344     variable data
00345 
00346     # Make sure the update button is visible
00347     grid $data($txt,win).show
00348 
00349   }

00351   ######################################################################
00352   # Executes the given diff command that produces diff output in unified
00353   # format.  Updates the specified text widget with the result.  The
00354   # command must be called only after the file is inserted into the editor.
00355   # Additionally, the file that is in the editor must be the same version
00356   # that is associated with the '+++' file in the diff output.
00357   proc parse_unified_diff {txt cmd} {
00358     
00359     # Execute the difference command
00360     catch { exec -ignorestderr {*}$cmd } rc
00361 
00362     # Open the UI for editing
00363     $txt configure -state normal
00364 
00365     # Reset the diff output
00366     $txt diff reset
00367 
00368     # Initialize variables
00369     set adds       0
00370     set subs       0
00371     set strSub     ""
00372     set total_subs 0
00373 
00374     # Parse the output
00375     foreach line [split $rc \n] {
00376       if {[regexp {^@@\s+\-\d+,\d+\s+\+(\d+),\d+\s+@@$} $line -> tline]} {
00377         set adds   0
00378         set subs   0
00379         set strSub ""
00380         incr tline $total_subs
00381       } else {
00382         if {[regexp {^\+([^+]|$)} $line]} {
00383           if {$subs > 0} {
00384             $txt diff sub [expr $tline - $subs] $subs $strSub
00385             set subs   0
00386             set strSub ""
00387           }
00388           incr adds
00389         } elseif {[regexp {^\-([^-].*$|$)} $line -> str]} {
00390           if {$adds > 0} {
00391             $txt diff add [expr $tline - $adds] $adds
00392             set adds 0
00393           }
00394           append strSub "$str\n"
00395           incr subs
00396           incr total_subs
00397         } else {
00398           if {$adds > 0} {
00399             $txt diff add [expr $tline - $adds] $adds
00400             set adds 0
00401           } elseif {$subs > 0} {
00402             $txt diff sub [expr $tline - $subs] $subs $strSub
00403             set subs   0
00404             set strSub ""
00405           }
00406         }
00407         incr tline
00408       }
00409     }
00410 
00411     # Disable the text window from editing
00412     $txt configure -state disabled
00413     
00414     # Update the map widget
00415     map_configure $txt
00416 
00417   }
00418

00423   ######################################################################
00424   # Handles Perforce commands
00425   namespace eval perforce {
00426 
00427     proc name {} {
00428       return "Perforce"
00429     }
00430 
00431     proc type {} {
00432       return "cvs"
00433     }
00434 
00435     proc handles {fname} {
00436       return [expr {![catch { exec p4 filelog $fname }]}]
00437     }
00438 
00439     proc versions {fname} {
00440       set versions [list]
00441       if {![catch { exec p4 filelog $fname } rc]} {
00442         foreach line [split $rc \n] {
00443           if {[regexp {^\.\.\.\s+#(\d+)} $line -> version]} {
00444             lappend versions $version
00445           }
00446         }
00447       }
00448       return $versions
00449     }
00450 
00451     proc get_file_cmd {version fname} {
00452       return "|p4 print $fname#$version"
00453     }
00454 
00455     proc show_diff {txt v1 v2 fname} {
00456       if {$v2 eq "Current"} {
00457         set ::env(P4DIFF) ""
00458         diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "p4 diff -du ${fname}#$v1"
00459       } else {
00460         diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "p4 diff2 -u ${fname}#$v1 ${fname}#$v2"
00461       }
00462     }
00463 
00464   }

00466   ######################################################################
00467   # Handles Mercurial commands
00468   namespace eval mercurial {
00469 
00470     proc name {} {
00471       return "Mercurial"
00472     }
00473 
00474     proc type {} {
00475       return "cvs"
00476     }
00477 
00478     proc handles {fname} {
00479       return [expr {![catch { exec hg status $fname }]}]
00480     }
00481 
00482     proc versions {fname} {
00483       set versions [list]
00484       if {![catch { exec hg log $fname } rc]} {
00485         foreach line [split $rc \n] {
00486           if {[regexp {changeset:\s+(\d+):} $line -> version]} {
00487             lappend versions $version
00488           }
00489         }
00490       }
00491       return $versions
00492     }
00493 
00494     proc get_file_cmd {version fname} {
00495       return "|hg cat -r $version $fname"
00496     }
00497 
00498     proc show_diff {txt v1 v2 fname} {
00499       if {$v2 eq "Current"} {
00500         diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "hg diff -r $v1 $fname"
00501       } else {
00502         diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "hg diff -r $v1 -r $v2 $fname"
00503       }
00504     }
00505 
00506   }

00508   ######################################################################
00509   # Handles Subversion commands
00510   namespace eval subversion {
00511 
00512     proc name {} {
00513       return "Subversion"
00514     }
00515 
00516     proc type {} {
00517       return "cvs"
00518     }
00519 
00520     proc handles {fname} {
00521       return [expr {![catch { exec svn log $fname }]}]
00522     }
00523 
00524     proc versions {fname} {
00525       set versions [list]
00526       if {![catch { exec svn log $fname } rc]} {
00527         foreach line [split $rc \n] {
00528           if {[regexp {^r(\d+)\s*\|} $line -> version]} {
00529             lappend versions $version
00530           }
00531         }
00532       }
00533       return $versions
00534     }
00535 
00536     proc get_file_cmd {version fname} {
00537       return "|svn cat -r $version $fname"
00538     }
00539 
00540     proc show_diff {txt v1 v2 fname} {
00541       if {$v2 eq "Current"} {
00542         diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "svn diff -r $v1 $fname"
00543       } else {
00544         diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "svn diff -r $v1:$v2 $fname"
00545       }
00546     }
00547 
00548   }

00550   ######################################################################
00551   # Handles CVS commands
00552   namespace eval cvs {
00553 
00554     proc name {} {
00555       return "CVS"
00556     }
00557 
00558     proc type {} {
00559       return "cvs"
00560     }
00561 
00562     proc handles {fname} {
00563       return [expr {![catch { exec cvs log $fname }]}]
00564     }
00565 
00566     proc versions {fname} {
00567       set versions [list]
00568       if {![catch { exec cvs log $fname } rc]} {
00569         foreach line [split $rc \n] {
00570           if {[regexp {^revision\s+(.*)$} $line -> version]} {
00571             lappend versions $version
00572           }
00573         }
00574       }
00575       return $versions
00576     }
00577 
00578     proc get_file_cmd {version fname} {
00579       return "|cvs update -p -r $version $fname"
00580     }
00581 
00582     proc show_diff {txt v1 v2 fname} {
00583       if {$v2 eq "Current"} {
00584         diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "cvs diff -u -r $v1 $fname"
00585       } else {
00586         diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "cvs diff -u -r $v1 -r $v2 $fname"
00587       }
00588     }
00589 
00590   }

00592   ######################################################################
00593   # Handles diff commands
00594   namespace eval diff {
00595 
00596     proc name {} {
00597       return "diff"
00598     }
00599 
00600     proc type {} {
00601       return "file"
00602     }
00603 
00604     proc handles {fname} {
00605       return 0
00606     }
00607 
00608     proc show_diff {txt fname1 fname2} {
00609       diff::parse_unified_diff $txt "diff -u $fname1 $fname2"
00610     }
00611 
00612   }

00615   # Handles custom commands
00616   namespace eval custom {
00617     
00618     proc name {} {
00619       return "custom"
00620     }
00621     
00622     proc type {} {
00623       return "command"
00624     }
00625     
00626     proc handles {fname} {
00627       return 0
00628     }
00629     
00630     proc show_diff {txt command} {
00631       diff::parse_unified_diff $txt $command
00632     }
00633     
00634   }

00636   ######################################################################
00637   # DIFFERENCE MAP WIDGET
00638   ######################################################################
00639   
00640   ######################################################################
00641   # Creates the difference map which is basically a colored scrollbar.
00642   proc map {win txt args} {
00643     
00644     variable data
00645     
00646     array set opts {
00647       -command ""
00648     }
00649     array set opts $args
00650     
00651     # Get the background color
00652     set bg [utils::get_default_background]
00653     
00654     # Create the canvas
00655     set data($txt,canvas) [canvas $win -width 15 -relief flat -bd 1 -highlightthickness 0 -bg $bg]
00656     
00657     # Create canvas bindings
00658     bind $data($txt,canvas) <Configure>  [list [ns diff]::map_configure $txt]
00659     bind $data($txt,canvas) <Button-1>   [list [ns diff]::map_position_slider %W %y $txt $opts(-command)]
00660     bind $data($txt,canvas) <B1-Motion>  [list [ns diff]::map_position_slider %W %y $txt $opts(-command)]
00661     bind $data($txt,canvas) <MouseWheel> "event generate $txt.t <MouseWheel> -delta %D"
00662     bind $data($txt,canvas) <4>          "event generate $txt.t <4>"
00663     bind $data($txt,canvas) <5>          "event generate $txt.t <5>"
00664     
00665     rename ::$win $win
00666     interp alias {} ::$win {} [ns diff]::map_command $txt
00667     
00668     return $win
00669     
00670   }
00671   
00672   ######################################################################
00673   # Executes map commands.
00674   proc map_command {txt args} {
00675     
00676     variable data
00677     
00678     set args [lassign $args cmd]
00679     
00680     switch $cmd {
00681       
00682       set {
00683         lassign $args first last
00684         set height [winfo height $data($txt,canvas)]
00685         set y1     [expr int( $height * $first )]
00686         
00687         # Adjust the size and position of the slider
00688         $data($txt,canvas) coords $data($txt,slider) 2 [expr $y1 + 2] 15 [expr $y1 + $data($txt,sheight)]
00689       }
00690       
00691       default {
00692         return -code error "difference map called with invalid command ($cmd)"
00693       }
00694       
00695     }
00696     
00697   }
00698   
00699   ######################################################################
00700   # Handles a left-click or click-drag in the canvas area, positioning
00701   # the cursor at the given position.
00702   proc map_position_slider {W y txt cmd} {
00703     
00704     variable data
00705     
00706     if {$cmd ne ""} {
00707       
00708       # Calculate the moveto fraction
00709       set moveto [expr ($y.0 - ($data($txt,sheight) / 2)) / [winfo height $W]]
00710        
00711       # Call the command
00712       uplevel #0 "$cmd moveto $moveto"
00713       
00714     }
00715     
00716   }
00717   
00718   ######################################################################
00719   # Called whenever the map widget is configured.
00720   proc map_configure {txt} {
00721     
00722     variable data
00723     
00724     # Remove all canvas items
00725     $data($txt,canvas) delete all
00726     
00727     # Add the difference bars
00728     foreach type [list sub add] {
00729       foreach {start end} [$txt diff ranges $type] {
00730         set start_line [lindex [split $start .] 0]
00731         set end_line   [lindex [split $end .] 0]
00732         map_add $txt $type $start_line [expr $end_line - $start_line]
00733       }
00734     }
00735     
00736     # Calculate the slider height
00737     lassign [$txt yview] first last
00738     set height             [winfo height $data($txt,canvas)]
00739     set sheight            [expr ((int( $height * $last ) - int( $height * $first )) + 1) - 4]
00740     set data($txt,sheight) [expr ($sheight < 11) ? 11 : $sheight]
00741     
00742     # Add cursor
00743     set bg                [utils::get_default_background]
00744     set abg               [utils::auto_adjust_color $bg 50]
00745     set data($txt,slider) [$data($txt,canvas) create rectangle 2 0 15 10 -outline $abg -width 2]
00746     map_command $txt set $first $last
00747     
00748   }
00749   
00750   ######################################################################
00751   # Adds a sub or add bar to the associated widget.
00752   proc map_add {txt type start lines} {
00753     
00754     variable data
00755     
00756     # Get the number of lines in the text widget
00757     set txt_lines [lindex [split [$txt index end-1c] .] 0]
00758     
00759     # Get the height of the box to add
00760     set y1 [expr int( ($start.0 / $txt_lines) * [winfo height $data($txt,canvas)] )]
00761     set y2 [expr int( (($start + $lines.0) / $txt_lines) * [winfo height $data($txt,canvas)] )]
00762     
00763     # Get the color to display
00764     set color [expr {($type eq "sub") ? [$txt cget -diffsubbg] : [$txt cget -diffaddbg]}]
00765     
00766     # Create the rectangle and place it in the widget
00767     $data($txt,canvas) create rectangle 0 $y1 15 $y2 -fill $color -width 0
00768     
00769   }
00770 
00771 }
Generated on Mon Mar 30 00:02:06 2015 for TKE by  1.6.3
